Class EncounterStorage

  • java.lang.Object

  • public class EncounterStorage
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Encounter> encounters
      Used as the storage for all of the encounters taken from the file.
      private static boolean errorOccured
      Represents if an error has occured in reading from the file.
      private java.lang.String FILE_NAME
      Represents the file that the encounters are stored in
      private java.lang.String[] POSSIBLE_NAMES
      List of the possible names of entities, must be appended if a new Entity is added.

      Constructor and Description
      EncounterStorage()
      Creates a list of all the encounters with the different types of AI

    • Method Detail

      • thisValueExists

        public boolean thisValueExists(java.lang.String name)
        Identifies if this specific type of Entity has any previous encounters
        Parameters:
        name - indicates the type of Entity
        Returns:
        true if they have had previous encounter, false if not.

      • thisValueExists

        private boolean thisValueExists(int index)
        Indicates if the Encounter at this specific index exists
        Parameters:
        index - indicates the index to be checked
        Returns:
        true if this Encounter exists, false if not.

      • checkDataExists

        public boolean checkDataExists()
        Checks to see if there any previous encounters to work with
        Returns:
        true if there are previous encounters, false if not.

      • checkFileEmpty

        private boolean checkFileEmpty()
        There is an issue of not being able to delete files, this checks if file is actually empty. Attempts to read the first line in the file to see if there is a value there.
        Returns:
        true if file is empty, false if populated.

      • getEncounter

        public Encounter getEncounter(java.lang.String name)
        Gets the encounter of a specific type of Entity
        Parameters:
        name - indicates the type of Entity by their name
        Returns:
        the Encounter value itself taken from the list, returns null if it doesn't exist

      • getEncounter

        public Encounter getEncounter(int index)
        Gets the encounter at a specific index from the list, normally used if accessing all encounters
        Parameters:
        index - indicates the index in the list of the specifc encounter
        Returns:
        the Encounter value itself found at this index

      • getAllEncounters

        public java.util.ArrayList<Encounter> getAllEncounters()
        Gives access to methods for all Encounters in the list, can be used to find the size or access individual ones.
        Returns:
        the list of all encounters.

      • addEncounter

        public void addEncounter(Encounter encounter)
        Gives access to the add method of the list of encounters, adds an encounter to the list
        Parameters:
        encounter - indicates the Encounter object being added to the list

      • replaceEncounter

        public void replaceEncounter(java.lang.String name,
                    Encounter newEncounter)
        Replaces an Encounter in the list with a new one that may or may not have different values
        Parameters:
        name - indicates the name of the type of Encounter that this is directed at
        newEncounter - indicates the Encounter to replace the one in the list with

      • removeAll

        public void removeAll()
        Removes every single Encounter from encounters.

      • getTotalPlayed

        public int getTotalPlayed()
        Gets the total amount of games that the user has played against every type of Entity
        Returns:
        the amount of games played

      • getTotalWon

        public int getTotalWon()
        Getst the total amount of times that the user has won a game against every type of Entity
        Returns:
        the total amount of times the user has won

      • getTotalDrew

        public int getTotalDrew()
        Gets the amount of times that the user has drew against every type of Entity
        Returns:
        the total amount of times the user has drew

      • getTotalLost

        public int getTotalLost()
        Gets the amount of times that the user has lost against every type of Entity
        Returns:
        the total amount of times the user has lost

      • storeData

        public void storeData()
        Stores the list of Encounters in the encounter file

      • attemptFileReadAmount

        private int attemptFileReadAmount(java.util.Scanner fileScanner)
        Attempts to read an integer value from a file. Uses a NumberFormatException to see if a non-number value is passed if so then returns 0 and notifies that there was a bug
        Parameters:
        fileScanner - indicates the Scanner object connected to the File
        Returns:
        the integer value of the record, will be 0 if an error

      • skipThroughFile

        private void skipThroughFile(java.util.Scanner fileScanner)
        Skips through this current encounter in the file. Because this is based on the name of the Encounter it still has three values after it so we skip those three extra lines
        Parameters:
        fileScanner - fileScanner indicates the Scanner object connected to the File

      • getErrorOccured

        public boolean getErrorOccured()
        Indicates whether an error has occured in reading the file
        Returns:
        a boolean value as to whether an error has occured

      • attemptFileReadName

        private java.lang.String attemptFileReadName(java.util.Scanner fileScanner)
        Attempts to read the name of an encounter. Uses the POSSIBLE_NAMES to see if the name is linked to the one read, if it is unable to read it then it notifies that there was a bug in the file.
        Parameters:
        fileScanner - indicates the Scanner object connected to the File
        Returns:
        a String value indicating the name of the encounter

      • fillData

        private void fillData()
        Loops through the encounters text file and attempts to populate the encounters list.
